content:
estrictions which curtail the rights of a single racial group are immedi-
ately suspect. That is not to say that all such restrictions are unconstitutional. 
It is to say that the courts must subject them to the most rigid scrutiny.
It is ironic that the Court did not strike down the Japanese relocation orders,
but  these  cases  established  a  new  interpretation  of  equal  protection  that
eventually greatly increased the power of the courts to strike down discrim-
inatory laws.
On this new
